version_description:
* Added an option to schedule app launch
* Fixes for watch app and watch complication
* More minor fixes and improvements

Ratings are like gold for indie developers like me, please take a moment to rate the app on the App Store.

* Hotfix for crashes introduced in the previous update
* Added an option to schedule app launch
* Fixes for watch app and watch complication
* More minor fixes and improvements

Ratings are like gold for indie developers like me, please take a moment to rate the app on the App Store.

In the latest update, I have tried to solve the biggest problem this app has - connectivity issues. I added a new method of connecting to Mac, using Multipeer Connectivity and hoped it would solve the issues caused by firewalls, strict network configurations and lack of Wi-Fi networks to work with. Unfortunately, I got many reports that it's causing a slowdown of internet connections, and in addition to that, it still hasn't solved this issues mentioned above :( - so this update removes it, and I will be going back to the drawing board.

# Requires new version of the Mac helper app - 9.8.0

Ratings are like gold for indie developers like me, please take a moment to rate the app on the App Store.

Main focus of this update is to make the app more user friendly by moving some stuff around. Bring to front most used features, and simplify interactions.
* Airplay Display controls now appear along with other media control tabs
* Scheduled system actions now appear when tapping on clock icon in the SYSTEM tab
* Keyboard can be shown and dismissed by tapping keyboard button in the trackpad view
Also:
* Show when left mouse button is locked in pressed state
* Fix crash occurring after scanning QR code

If someone is left to read it :-O with all this Coronavirus craziness...

I'm spending more time at home even though the weather gets nicer,
and I'm using the app more and more to watch movies and tv shows on my Mac connected to my HDTV, cause what else you suppose to do, right?

And the more I used the app, the more I wanted it to be better, and so I made some changes that you might like too:
* Great keypad editor, with all the app actions, and color customizations for keys
* Sync keypads, app favorites, and website links between devices using iCloud
* KeyPad store so I can easily add new keypads for more apps

And the more I used the app, the more I wanted it to be better, and so I made some changes that you might like too:
* Great keypad editor, with all the app actions, and color customizations for keys
* Sync keypads, app favorites, and website links between devices using iCloud
* KeyPad store so I can easily add new keypads for more apps
